medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented at 3 months of age with painful inflammation of the right femur, accompanied by elevated serum markers of inflammation. Patient 2 exhibited widening and inflammation of long bones at birth. Patient 3 experienced heart failure at 3 weeks due to a patent ductus, and other developmental delays were noted. Patient 1's symptoms progressed to include multiple skeletal deformities, while all patients demonstrated developmental delays and joint contractures over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Growth hormone deficiency (in 2 patients), Chiari malformation (in 2 patients), and various skeletal abnormalities including fractures and contractures. No retinal changes observed in any patients.
medical_history.family_history: Family 1 involved consanguineous parents with a homozygous mutation in TNFRSF11B. Family 2 had a non-consanguineous German couple, with a novel homozygous 4 bp insertion in TNFRSF11B. Family 3 included a British couple of Pakistani descent with a homozygous microdeletion at 8q24.12, containing TNFRSF11B.
